image.altText: A close up of bunches of flowers on the ground and a basketball upon which someone has written "RIP angels"

props.synopsis: The parents and loved ones of the children who died as a result of a jumping castle lifting into the air three years ago have endured two weeks of emotionally charged debate, complex technical discussions and arguing by experts in a Tasmanian court room.

title.children: Hillcrest jumping castle tragedy court case puts parents, loved ones, through yet another ordeal in search for answers

image.altText: Exterior shot of an old court building.

props.synopsis: A man who a tribunal heard pushed his ex-wife to the ground while she was on crutches and injured her face with his foot or leg has been barred from re-registering as a psychologist, after his Supreme Court appeal was dismissed.

title.children: Former psychologist who pushed ex-wife on crutches to the ground loses appeal to practise in Tasmania

image.altText: Smoke emerges from the top of a large white and red cruise ship at night with lights reflected in water below.

props.synopsis: The recent TT-Line and TasPorts failures with the Spirit of Tasmania ferry replacement project puts government businesses in the spotlight. Join Airlie Ward and state political reporter Adam Langenberg.

title.children: Listen to TassieCast 🔊 Are Tasmania's government-owned businesses on the line for privatisation?

image.altText: An older woman with white hair sits on a seat in their living room.

props.synopsis: Caring for her mother for over 13 years, Beth Jackson gave up a huge chunk of career earnings and superannuation. But advocates say the sacrifices people like Beth make should entitle them to a better deal at the other end.

title.children: 'A nightmare … I really wasn't prepared for how the system doesn't work': The reality of caring for an elderly loved one

image.altText: A man in a grey suit and a red striped tie leaves a building. Two other people are in front of him, out of focus.

props.synopsis: Tasmanian judge Gregory Geason has been sentenced to a 12-month community corrections order with 100 hours of community work for assaulting and emotionally abusing a woman.

title.children: 'You have not demonstrated any remorse': Supreme Court judge sentenced after being found guilty of assaulting woman

image.altText: Danny Gibson smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: The former mayor and current councillor of Tasmania's second-largest city has resigned from his position on the Local Government Association of Tasmania, with allegations of unwanted sexual advances against young men unaddressed.

title.children: Calls for an 'independent investigation' after thousands in ratepayer funds spent on Tasmanian councillors' legal fees

image.altText: A woman wearing a blue and white floral shirt stands in front of a cream coloured house, smiling.

props.synopsis: Many 26- to 65-year-olds who "fell between the cracks" when it came to accessing government assistance have turned to Sarah Dockrell and her hearing aid bank.

title.children: Did you miss? 📣 Meet the Tasmanian woman providing hearing aids to those in need, free of charge

image.altText: Donald Trump, wearing a suit, walks with his daughter Ivanka, in a jewelled wedding gown, through giant hydrangea arches

props.synopsis: Donald Trump flipped Michigan and wooed Arab-American voters with the help of a Lebanese-American tycoon, who's now shaping up to lead talks to end Israel's war with Hezbollah.

title.children: How a lavish Trump wedding might end up unexpectedly reshaping the Middle East

image.altText: A man holds a blown-up copy of Project 2025, resting it on a podium

props.synopsis: With Donald Trump set to return to the White House in January, concerns around Project 2025 continue to swirl. Here are the policies it puts forward and whether we can expect to see them enacted.

title.children: Will Trump enact Project 2025? Here's what it proposes

image.altText: A composite picture of a woman in black-and-white and a man in colour, both looking serious.

props.synopsis: While other central banks have reacted to a sudden drop in inflation, the Reserve Bank of Australia has been reluctant to move, raising questions about whether it may leave rates too high as the economy cools.

title.children: Why Australia is lagging the pack on rate cuts

image.altText: Two women leave court, with their faces blurred.

props.synopsis: With the trial of two WA parents accused of starving their daughter drawing to a close, a jury will soon have to decide whether they intentionally denied her nourishment to keep her their "little girl forever".

title.children: 'She'll always be my little girl': A mother accused of starving her only child tells her side of the story

image.altText: Steven Cheung wearing a black suit and tie walking down a hallway alongisde two advisors

props.synopsis: Steven Cheung, who led communications for Donald Trump's latest election campaign, will become the face of the president-elect's new administration.

title.children: Donald Trump names White House communications director

image.altText: A composite image of Clarke and Seymour in the chamber

props.synopsis: Hana-Rāwhiti Maipi-Clarke's viral protest inside New Zealand's parliament was an objection to a piece of legislation that is "looking for a problem where there isn't one".

title.children: 'Congratulations David Seymour': The protests in NZ are about to get bigger and one person is being blamed

image.altText: The sun sets over a beach.

props.synopsis: Parts of South Australia are bracing for catastrophic fire conditions amid a burst of early summer season heat, with neighbouring regions in Victoria also on high alert.

title.children: Catastrophic fire conditions forecast for parts of SA as CFS warns of 'very challenging' weather

image.altText: Two police officers in uniform face away from the camera

props.synopsis: Lawyers and Aboriginal police officers have slammed an investigation into racism within the NT Police Force as "flawed" and "an attempt to wipe the slate clean", after the review found no evidence of racist behaviour since 2015.

title.children: 'Effectively became an investigation about nothing': Experts point to flaws in NT police racism review

image.altText: Woman with dark hair and lip ring stands in her house doorway.

props.synopsis: Thousands of Australian women deal with premenstrual dysphoric disorder, or PMDD, and symptoms can include extreme mood changes, depression and anxiety.

title.children: The little-known condition making the lives of thousands of women hell each month

image.altText: An older man looks sternly ahead while sitting in his office.

props.synopsis: The Catholic Church has won a High Court appeal against rulings it is vicariously liable for the actions of a priest who allegedly sexually abused a five-year-old in 1971, sparking calls for change.

title.children: Who's responsible? High Court under fire over Catholic Church abuse case

image.altText: Teen girl with curly hair and tan skin looks down at her phone wearing a stripy jumper. There are social media icons next to her

props.synopsis: Legislation to ban under-16s from social media will be put before parliament next week, but some platforms could be exempt from the proposed changes.

title.children: The social media platforms that look set to be banned for under-16s

image.altText: Graphic featuring photos of murdered teens Anita Cunningham and Robin Hoinville-Bartram.

props.synopsis: David Cunningham's sister was murdered while hitchhiking in Queensland. Over 50 years on, he wants a commission of inquiry into the case.

title.children: Two teenage girls were murdered while hitchhiking on Queensland's 'highway of death'. Some believe their killer can still be found

image.altText: Bags of cheap carrots at Woolworths supermarket with a sign that states $1.70 a kilogram

props.synopsis: The way big stores deal with farmers and how they make money from fresh food specials have been a focus in the first two weeks of the ACCC's supermarket inquiry.

title.children: Cheap 'clickbait' carrots used to lure shoppers at farmers' expense, supermarket inquiry hears

image.altText: Max Chandler-Mather speaks while standing in front of the budget tree at parliament house

props.synopsis: Government sources have criticised the Greens' late appeal for a compromise on the housing bills, arguing the process of having amendments costed, drafted and approved can take months.

title.children: Greens make new offer to pass Labor's key housing bills, but deal still looks unlikely

image.altText: The large yellow M4 floating in the ocean, in front of a small island.

props.synopsis: Australia has some of the best waves in the world and researchers say it could be a global leader in creating electricity from our oceans. So what's the hold-up?

title.children: After several false starts, is wave energy being swept out to sea in the renewables race?

image.altText: A person wearing a backpack stands in a forest of lush greenery, ferns and tall trees.

props.synopsis: No trace has ever been found of missing Cessna 210 VH-MDX, despite 43 years of searching.

title.children: VH-MDX vanished without a trace 43 years ago with five people onboard. These people are still searching

image.altText: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and President Donald Trump standing side by side on the steps of the White House.

props.synopsis: A senior Hamas official says its mediators would accept "any proposal submitted to it" that would lead to a ceasefire and Israel's withdrawal from the Gaza Strip.

title.children: Hamas says it is 'ready' for peace in Gaza, urging Trump to apply pressure on Israel

image.altText: GettyImages-2184089252

props.synopsis: Mike Tyson says he slapped Jake Paul after the YouTuber stepped on his foot during their feisty weigh-in on Friday.

title.children: 'I think it may have happened on purpose': New footage shows why Tyson slapped Paul at weigh-in

image.altText: A white stone statue sculpture of the Virgin Mary carrying a child on a bed of white roses

props.synopsis: The 1.8-metre stone sculpture is a symbol of hope and faith for Catholics, and was relocated after the 2019 fire that devastated the historic cathedral.

title.children: Notre Dame's Virgin Mary statue returned to cathedral

image.altText: Blue and red graphic of man and woman holding up scan of baby

props.synopsis: Gender disappointment still divides families and is sometimes perpetuated by mothers who experienced it themselves, straining relations between parents and children — especially girls.

title.children: These children weren't the gender their parents hoped for — and they were resented for it

image.altText: Arms of woman in purple long-sleeved top using mobile phone with blue and grey case.

props.synopsis: As the government ponders an unprecedented ban on social media use by under 16s, I can report from the front lines of juvenile social media activity that the troops are nervous. Even pretty angry.

title.children: Beware the wrath of teens missing their internet connection

image.altText: Red smoke drifts up from a factory on fire.

props.synopsis: An early-morning warehouse fire in West Melbourne that caused the evacuation of 150 apartment residents has been deemed suspicious.

title.children: Residents evacuated from Melbourne CBD hi-rise after 'suspicious' fire engulfs empty warehouse

image.altText: A graphic of Asquith Girls High School.

props.synopsis: Parents raise concerns about a New South Wales government move to covert schools in Sydney's north and south to co-educational schools as part of a plan to bring more subject offerings and extra-curricular programs to students.

title.children: Sydney high school parents vent frustration at plan for single-sex schools to become co-educational

image.altText: A man standing on a boat mast with an animatronic shark in the water below him.

props.synopsis: The 1975 blockbuster Jaws told the story of the hunt for a gigantic, bloodthirsty, rogue shark that attacked numerous swimmers at a fictional beach resort in the US. Its repercussions are still being felt nearly 50 years later.

title.children: What Jaws got right and horribly wrong about great white sharks

image.altText: GettyImages-2185013521

props.synopsis: Cristiano Ronaldo scores a stunning bicycle kick goal as Portugal downs Poland 5-1 in the Nations League.

title.children: Ronaldo winds back the clock with stunning goal for Portugal in Nations League

image.altText: Rory standing on his family property. He has a mullet and is wearing a hoodie.

props.synopsis: The 15-year-old used to think his diagnosis was a burden. Now the budding young musician realises it is helping him play to his strengths.

title.children: Rory dreams of being a famous drummer, and his ADHD might help him get there

image.altText: A man in the water with goggles on.

props.synopsis: Taking a weekly plunge in swimming spots across the city, Chris Baker reflects on what draws us to the water to navigate life's ups and downs.

title.children: From wild waterholes to mid-century municipal pools, Sydney is the 'world's most swimmable city' for this writer
